description:
Using Ubuntu 18.04 LTS

I have been using this extensively to download both audio and video.
It has worked perfectly and flawlessly and was very easy to use.

Until NOW!

For some reason best know to himself/herself the author of this application has decided to cosmetically change the look and feel. BUT in order to do so it appears that they implemented the very latest Python code.

Now, when I try to run the application I'm told I'm using an "Unsupported version of Python and I need to upgrade"

I'm sorry, but all the other applications are working perfectly on the existing Python code and I'm not going to risk new problems developing on more important applications just because some numpty tells me to upgrade suddenly - in order to suit HIS whim!!

There are plenty of equally good applications for downloading video and audio. This application will be removed and I shall move on.

Shame really! Believe it or not, I was even considering sending a donation. Not going to happen now. I'm already trying out Ultimate Downloader. 

If it ain't broke, don't try and fix it, dummy!

Thisisi

Was working fine until this latest "Upgrade". Now it will not do anything at all in Ubuntu. To the developer, the version of Python you have used is not yet live in Ubuntu or any other distros due to it being EXPERIMENTAL.
This program now does not work on anything and forcing an update of Python to the one suggested, breaks a whole host of other essential functions, including making it impossible to run Terminal to fix the mess.
Yes it look 'pretty' but other than that, it is just pretty useless.
summary: If it ain't broke, don't fix it

description:
In the past I have found this very useful
Now, suddenly it has been upgraded to make it "Look Pretty"
The upgrade was made using the very latest and apparently experimental version of Python and is NOT backwards compatible.

WHY? WHY? WHY? WHY? WHY? WHY? WHY? 

It worked perfectly and now it's screwed!

IF ITS NOT BROKEN DON'T TRY TO 'FIX' IT, Dummy!

If the previous version of Video Downloader won't work with the existing Python Code, then it's VERY likely that all my other applications won't work on the new, latest code. That means that I would probably have to do a complete reinstall of EVERYTHING in order to be able to keep working.

I've searched the Snap Store offerings and I'm now using "Ultimate Downloader," I've used it several times already - WITHOUT needing the very latest Python Code, and so far it has worked perfectly for me. It's very similar to this App - simply Copy and Paste a URL, it shows the various quality options - mp3, mp4, etc etc. Select the quality you want and - Bingo! it downloads to a 'UMD4' folder in 'Dowloads'.

Forget this application ! The author is clearly a 'fiddler' so goodness knows what else is going to be tweaked and then cause further problems.
summary: RUBBISH. Was very good but now "Upgraded" to RUBBISH!!I

So long have I looked for an app like this where it seamingly does a good job of download. Keep this up ! Thank you.
it works as advertised. Thanks a million.

This program is simple and easy to use, allowing you to download individual videos or even entire playlists all at once. You can download videos at a resolution of your choosing, or download only the audio as an mp3 file. The user interface is more user friendly than youtube-dl, and runs more reliably and quickly than any comparable browser extension I have tried. Ten out of ten, would definitely recommend.
very good very good very good
So some genius decided to change a winning formula.

It works perfectly, easy and simple, but I think the user interface could be more functional. For example the option to download entire playlists or not could be before the downloading process, it would let the user keep working without opening the app again to answer to the pop up message.
summary: Easy, simple and works perfectly! And it can be even better

description:
Why this app wants to have permission to my home folder? 
I don't trust this app.
gets the job done
I loved it. It is easy to download....
Not worth it, downloaded file does not show video ..but audio

install all your software from snapcraft.io (including video downloader). every time i install stuff from Ubuntu Software i end up with problems. Otherwise from Terminal:

sudo snap install video-downloader

select MP4 as default format for saving videos:

snap run --shell video-downloader -c 'gsettings "$@"' '' set com.github.unrud.VideoDownloader prefer-mpeg true
it works great and easy to use.

Followed Joe's suggestions on installing this excellent, actually works, app via Snap! And it just does what it is supposed to do! 1. Copy URL, 2. open VD, 3. paste URL and 4. tic download. 5. DONE! 

  NO mess, no fuss and exactly what I needed for my DIY videos for studying, and reference!

  SO YEA, don't use Ubuntu Software installer, use Snap or Terminal and enjoy!
summary: Yes install from Snap or Terminal

description: Das Ding läuft super und ist sehr einfach zu bedienen! Nach sehr langer Suche ist es genau das, was ich von einem Video Downloader erwarte! Kein Schnickschnack oder Schickimicki - einfach Video/Musik downloaden - fertig!
Man muss sich für etwas anmelden und ich weiß nicht was und warum
....weil kann keine bezahl videos abspielen, daher unbrauchbar.
Macht genau das was er soll. Unkompliziert und einfach. Mehr braucht man nicht. Und das nicht nur bei Youtube.....
fehlt nur noch das der Speicherort festgelegt werden könnte (hier ist einer fest vorgegeben)
Das Programm arbeitet zuverlässig und ist einfach und schnell zu bedienen. DANKE !
Die Bedienung ist simpel und selbsterklärend und es funktioniert für verschiedene Seiten, neben YouTube auch auf diversen Mediatheken.
Tut was es soll, ohne viel tamtam. Ohne nervige Paywall und ähnliche Schikanen. Danke!
Läd ab 28.10.2020 keine YouTube Videos mehr
summary: Läd ab 28.10.2020 keine YouTube Videos mehr

ne fonctionne plus sur Ubuntu 18.04.3 LTS....
Après un premier téléchargement ( qui s'est très bien passé ), le programme ne s'exécute plus. Après une désinstallation puis une réinstallation, après des mis à jour et autres manipulations, impossible de l'exécuter depuis...
Merci aux développeurs pour la futur mis à jour.

Fonctionne parfaitement avec Ubuntu 18.04.3 LTS à jour, avec la version de V.D. téléchargée le 9 novembre 2019.

Application un peu light, mais elle fait ce qu'on lui demande, elle "balance" la vidéo en .webm dans les téléchargements, pas besoin de la chercher dans un sous répertoire d'un dossier système, c'est parfait.

On peut soit télécharger en vidéo soit audio, ça ok, mais on peut pas changer le nom lors de l'enregistrement et choisir les times codes, en fait il manque des options avancés sinon très minimaliste et fonctionne bien.
